dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A news crew shuttles around a GIGANTIC COOKIE. Standing b are the KOWOLSKI BROTHERS, GUSTOV and VOL, two SHORT, STO MEN, along with MOTHER KOWOLSKI and other bakery family employees. A "30 YEAR ANNIVERSARY" sign hangs in the background. BRUCE NOLAN looks into a make-up mirror, desperately tryi to place a large segment of wayward hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, no! The hair's wrong. This is a bad sign. (calling out) We really need to get a make-up person?! The segment producer, ALLY LOMAN, steps over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in the budget. And not to                         *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: worry, you're going to look great in this. She holds out a HAIR NET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hair net? I'm not wearing a hair net. I just did the hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (matter of fact) Health code. In the kitchen or around the cookie, you gotta have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to crew: re hair net) You guy's should tell me this before hand, this is like a huge waste of...moose. Bruce spreads the hair net, bends down out of frame, come looking ridiculous and very disgruntled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remind me to swing by an elementary                   * school after this and serve lunch. Ally laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a thing of beauty.     In three, two, one. . . Bruce SNAPS from pissed to instant charismatic TV newsman (Note: Whenever Bruce speaks on camera he speaks in his "REPORTER'S VOICE" - that recognizable, too-smooth delive that all news reporters seem to have. In mathematical ter Bruce's version is to the 7th power.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For three decades the Kowolski Family Bakery has been a mainstay in downtown Buffalo. Known for their sinfully rich, cream filled, deep fried polski pierogis. And the occasional sugar induced coma that follows. Today, in honor of their 30 year anniversary, Momma Kowolski and her sons Gustov and Vol, decided to do something, a little bit different. Tell me guys, how did this idea come about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well,    Vol said to me, 'Gustov, why don't    we make the biggest chocolate chip    cookie in Buffalo?' And I said,    'Yeah, sure.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Fascinating. Bruce steps up to the HUGE COOKIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The previous Buffalo cookie record was 3 feet, 17 inches baked by Gladys Pelsnick. But this behemoth cookie clearly proving that Gustov and Vol have much more free time. The Kowolski brothers and all celebrate in the background toasting with big mugs of milk. Bruce steps forward, look dramatically at camera, slow zoom in as he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we witness the ceremonial toasting with milk it makes one pause and think. What are we really looking at here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it just a big cookie or does this cookie represent the pride of Buffalo? Our dedicated and hard working citizens the key ingredient, with a few nuts thrown in. (motions his eyes to the Kowolski twins) And finally, the love of our families which provides the warm chewy center making our beloved Buffalo the sweetest place to live. Camera is in CLOSE as Bruce signs-off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's the way the cookie crumbles. I'm Bruce Nolan, Eyewitness News. Bruce's hair net SLIPS UP, PUFFING HIS HAIR INTO A BUN ON TOP OF HIS HEAD. The Kowolskis and bystanders all laugh. The frame FREEZES. We PULL BACK from the TV and find Bruce holding the remot watching the recorded spot on TV. We are now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce is with his longtime girlfriend, GRACE. She has a b of photos on the coffee table in front of her organizing into a photo album.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sucks. It's a story about a cookie. People with eating disorders will be riveted, (goes into huge pathetic fan character) Dear Bruce, love the bakery piece. I can't wait to vomit so I can make room for more cookies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was funny. I love the hair net. How'd you get it to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I'm cutting that. They made me wear that stupid thing. I don't even look like myself. The hair is one of the most important parts of an on camera persona. Right out of the gate, I lost the hair advantage. Grace looks at a photo,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my gosh, look at this one. My sister is so drunk. She places it in the album.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace. Try to stay focused here. I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you taking this a little too seriously?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's sweeps Grace. It is serious. There's an anchor job open. This is important. This is our future! Bruce points to the TV as he says "future," not realizing he's pointing at the ridiculous image of himself with the hair net bun. Grace can't help but giggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Bruce collapses into Grace's arms like a child. He clearl has a fragile temperament.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) I'm never going to get anchor doing these kind of assignments. I want my work to matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does matter. You're funny. You make people smile. Come on, take a break, help me put this album together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctant) Alright. Grace holds up a photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh look at this. It's the first day we moved in together. It's the two of them, younger, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (down) Yeah, so full of hopes and dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, here's me at my sister's wedding. I caught the bouquet. It's a picture of Grace overpowering the other bridesmaid for the bouquet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look pretty intense, hun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was thinking about you. Grace cuddles into Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you're attracted to me in some way, is that what you're trying to say? Grace rolls over onto Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was saving myself for the wedding night, but if you keep this up, I may lose my resolve. Grace stands, pulling Bruce up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's the way the cookie crumbles. They kiss, stumbling toward the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's a good line, but you need more resonance. From the diaphragm. (newscaster voice) That's the way the cookie crumbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, say it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bigger) That's the way the cookie crumbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sweet, southern groupie) Oh, I just love on-air personalities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (newscaster voice) Well then, let me take these clothes off and slip into my hair net. Grace laughs, Bruce joins in as they disappear into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: A TELEVISION SCREEN
dialogues.text: We see the INTRO FOR SIXTY MINUTES:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Ed Bradley, I'm Merely Safer, an d I ' m -- LESLIE STAHL is HIT IN THE NECK WITH A TRANQUILIZER DART. Her head wavers, then DROPS on the desk. The camera PANS BRUCE, who lowers a bamboo blow gun, cooly addresses came

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Bruce Nolan. And this is Sixty Minutes.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE'S ALARM CLOCK
dialogues.text: We are in. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce lies next to Grace with a big smile on his face. Gr hits the alarm, rolls over snuggling close to Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweety, time to get up... She kisses Bruce, gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm having a great dream. The covers are RIPPED OUT OF FRAME.   Bruce throws a mock hissy fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce watches TV as he buttons his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the Sabers lost another close one last night. Four to three to the Toronto Maple Leafs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course they lost, they're my team.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Bruce checks his hair in the mirror practicing his new si off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And that's the way the cookie crumbles." (calls to Grace) You know, I think there might be something to that cookie line. Everything great anchor has his own signature sign-off. (as Walter Cronkite) "And that's the way the cookie crumbles."

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Peeing in the corner on the carpet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no!   Grace, the dog!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in the shower!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah!

dialogues.text: Bruce runs along carrying the peeing Sam with extended ar dodges a man ascending the stares, who gets sprinkled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoops, sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce makes it outside, sets Sam down on the grass. Sam looks up innocently at Bruce, finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you're all done, huh? B-e-a-utiful.

dialogues.text: Bruce pulls up in his Ford Tauras to a cluster of cars unloading kids. A 2003 MERCEDES SRL passes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, nice car, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, if you want to rub your success in people's faces. Then Bruce notices a big medical van in front of the scho with a BLOOD DRIVE SIGN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with the hubbub?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're having a blood drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creepy. Needles, yech...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's a nice response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, it's just s o . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helpful and life saving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, that's your...blood. It's in your body and I don't think it's supposed to come out. Besides, they stockpile that stuff. They have an endless supply frozen in a warehouse somewhere then tell everyone there's a shortage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do not. Now stop it. I'm                        * giving. I have a very rare blood                     * type, AB positive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm IB positive. IB positive they aint touchin' me with no needle. Grace sighs in exasperation, starts out when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prayer beads. The kids made 'em. Keep you safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I hope they work, cause it's going take a miracle to get me to work on time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce is stuck in bumper to bumper traffic. He stares at prayer beads with a "thanks alot" look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big accident ahead. Bruce looks at his watch, he's screwed. A person is CARRIED BY ON A STRETCHER, Bruce is oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is just my luck. Bruce's BEEPER sounds.      He checks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meeting's starting, perfect... (thinks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw it. He looks to the right of the car in front of him, then pe off onto the shoulder, passing tons of cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Catch you later, lemmings 1 It's kill or be killed, only the strong survive, no guts, no glory1

dialogues.text: Bruce pulls over, fumes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking heavenward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.text: Bruce screeches into a space, races out of the car, bumpi over a trash can, goes back to pick it up, sees a HOMELES MAN who sits peacefully next to a paint bucket and sign boards. The various "warnings" change daily. Today's SIGN reads: R EWE BLIND?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce looks at the sign quizzically for a beat, then continues on.

dialogues.text: Bobby, I can't, I-- BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: EVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is something killing your kids? Find out tonight at eleven. Bruce looks at the sign quizzically for a beat, then continues on.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ROOM
dialogues.text: The morning meeting is well in progress. Leading the grou is the station manager and Bruce's boss, JACK KELLER, 50' constant furrow in his brow. Also in the room: Bruce's fellow field reporter and rival EVAN BAXTER, 30' s , a walking statement. Impeccable post perfect speech, perfect everything and he knows it. FRED DONOHUE, the ever jovial sports reporter; always tan vain weatherman, DALLAS COLEMAN and segment producer Ally Loman. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, promos are approved, let's-- ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, isn't that last one a little misleading? I mean, the story's about flu shots. Do we have to scare people to death? EVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, just into watching. Or I could change it to: "Slow news day, come yawn with us. At eleven." FRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Evan, you'11 know something when I know something. Bruce bursts into the room. The meeting stops. Jack doesn need to say anything, he just looks at his watch. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Jack. It wasn't my fault. The traffic was -- You guys already played the spots? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice story, Bruce, but we're going with Evan's piece on the sex scandal at the mayor's office for sweeps. This hits Bruce hard. A beat of silence. EVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is at Bobby's cart, paying for a sandwich. Bruce catches up .to him. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, Jack, hey.     Can I talk to you for a second? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it.    I called my aunt, we're on. Bruce looks at Bobby, continues after and catches Jack. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Jack. Hear me out, I'm getting desperate man, I am pushing forty and what have I got to show for it? The point is, I've hit some kind of a ceiling here. Some kind of anti-Bruce barrierI And Evan is just lovin' it, by the way. He gets the good stories, he gets on sweeps. Maybe I have to be more like Evan. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to be like Evan. Evan's an asshole. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can be an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Bruce.     You can't. Bruce thinks, then flips Jack's sandwich plate over. It scatters on the floor. Jack and Bruce stare at each other for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to pick that up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm sorry. Bruce bends down, starts picking up Jack's food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just- this anchor position looming, it's gotten me nuts... He hands the plate to Jack, as sexy anchorwoman SUSAN ORT saunters by.

dialogues.speaker: JACK BRUCE
dialogues.text: Hi, Susan.                           Hi, Susan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Jack. Bruce blanches at this obvious snubbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Bruce. You're a good reporter. You make people laugh. God knows today we can use it. Bruce slumps, he's heard this a thousand times before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Alright, tell you what. It's the                   * 23rd anniversary of the Maid of the Mist. I want you at Niagara Falls in an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maid of the Mist. That's always live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan gets the live feeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well now you and Evan get the live feeds. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going live. In sweeps. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but watch yourself, Bruce. I've seen your outtakes. Bruce hugs Jack, pressing the sandwich against his chest. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes 1 You will not regret this, Jack. (releases Jack) I will not forget you when I go national. Bruce takes off, Jack looks down, peels the sandwich off chest. We hear children's joyous SHRIEKS...

dialogues.text: Is it so wrong to tie them up?

dialogues.text: D eb -- Ma rt i n! Martin is busted with the paste spreader stuck in his mou Grace snatches it. GRACE

dialogues.text: If the moo fits. The phone RINGS.

dialogues.text: Saved by the bell.    Grab that for me, will you? Debbie does. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Live? That's greatI BRUCE

dialogues.text: Yep, it's happenin', hun. I got sweeps and I'm live. You know what that means? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my gosh. BRUCE

dialogues.text: This is happening for us, Grace. What we've always talked about. Jack practically came out and told me. Grace quickly switches gears.   She experienced the prema celebration before. GRACE

dialogues.text: (being cautious) I just want to make sure we're not getting too ahead of ourselves. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I totally agree, but in the mean time you should start thinking about what coast you want to live on. Ally interrupts, indicating the time. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, they're calling me, I gotta go. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck, honey. I love you.                          * BRUCE                                       *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.                                            * (hangs up)                                        * Debbie turns to Grace. DEBBIE                                       *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moooo.                                                 *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE                                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it.                                             *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ally hustles Bruce toward the bow of the boat, as he plac his ear piece. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want you close to the falls. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for? I'll get soaked. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the point.    They want you to hold up this. She hands Bruce a very stupid looking, blue "falls" shape UMBRELLA with the MAID OF THE MIST INSIGNIA. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part of the condition of us getting the exclusive. Bruce takes the umbrella.

dialogues.speaker: ' ' BRUCE
dialogues.text: Lovely.    Glad I wore my tap shoes. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, this is their 23rd anniversary. Capacity is 59. They cater to tourists, honeymooners. . . BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And people who are insanely                    '     * thirsty, I get it.                                   * ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you'll be interviewing Irene Dansfeild... She positions A VERY, VERY OLD WOMAN next to Bruce. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...She rode on the maiden voyage with her late husband. Okay, 90                      * seconds. Bruce looks upward at the ridiculous umbrella. Mutters encouragement to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 90 seconds, going live. Think anchor, think dignity, (glances up toward umbrella) Ignore umbrella. Just have fun.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIVE FEED IN THE CAMERA TRUCK AT THE FALLS
dialogues.text: Some of the CREW MEMBERS watch the feed.

dialogues.speaker: ON TV
dialogues.text: Pete Fineman is reporting. PETE FINEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but because of the fast response by our local fire fighters, the toxic chemicals were cleaned up without incident. Susan. The female co-anchor, SUSAN ORTEGA: SUSAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce Nolan is standing by at Niagara Falls with a report on the Maid of the Mist sightseeing boat, but before we go live to Bruce, we have an announcement to make. As everyone knows, after 33 years, our beloved Pete Fineman is retiring. Pete smiles a proud, heart-felt smile. SUSAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete's shoes are virtually impossible to fill, but the show must go on. And we could think of no one better than our very own Evan Baxter.

dialogues.speaker: ON BRUCE
dialogues.text: Listening to the feed. His FACE GOES WHITE.      He stand shock. Evan is seated next to Susan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Evan. Looks like we'll be sitting side by side from now on. EVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Susan. I ' m thrilled and honored. Like you said, no one can replace the great Pete Fineman, but I'll do my best. I have to say I am so proud to be a part of our local community. Of Buffalo. I think a great city is a lot like a great recipe really. Put in some hard working citizens, add some care givers, maybe a few nuts... The other news anchors and Evan himself chuckle at "his" joke. Bruce listens on the feed, beyond stunned. EVAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All sprinkled with the strength and love of our good families, that ultimately creates a sweet place to live. Thank you. SUSAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touched) Wow. That was amazing. And now let's go live to wacky Bruce Nolan out at Niagara Falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce stands like a deer in headlights, drenched, holding ridiculous umbrella. Ally sig nals Bruce he's on. He star into camera, numb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids are gone. Grace watches the TV with a few other teachers. She's concerned. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk honey, talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack rushes in, looking at Bruce on the monitor. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIRECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a Walt Disney. CONSOLE OPERATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frozen solid. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He may not have audio. Check his feed, have Susan cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan reacts to the message in her ear piece. SUSAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We may be having a bit of technical difficulty... Evan smiles in the background, clearly enjoying himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONSOLE OPERATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feed's good, Jack. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Bruce, talk damn-it... Okay, get ready to pull the plug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please baby, say something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like popping out of a coma, Bruce surges in. Surprisingly seems very up and fine. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Susan 1 Bruce Nolan here aboard the Maid of the Mist at Niagara falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs relief) Thank God. Jack pats the Director's shoulder, heads out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First off, "I want to add another congratulations to Evan Baxter. It's good to see what someone with real talent can accomplish when great opportunities are given to him instead of me. (still smiling) Anyway, I'm here, I believe with Katherine Hepburn's mom. Tell me, why did you toss the blue "heart of the ocean" jewel over the railing of Titanic? The Old Woman doesn't know what to say. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you feel guilty at all letting Leonardo Decaprio freeze, while you were safe floating on the big door? Do you think he would have survived if you had taken turns, or were you too afraid to freeze your big fat ass off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack rockets back into the room. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I just hear..? BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess that's the way life works, isn't it? Some people are drenched, freezing to death, on a stupid boat, with a stupid umbrella... (heaves the umbrella) while others who aren't fit to kiss my willy, are sitting in a nice, comfy news room, sucking up all the glory111

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't happening. This isn't happening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce takes off walking, the camera follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, lets speak to the owner. Come on in here, Bill. Bill shakes his head "NO" as Bruce pulls him into frame. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, you.'ve been running the Maid of the Mist for 23 years. Tell me, why do you think I didn't get the anchor job? BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man, I don't want any-- BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think it's my hair? (Bruce messes his hair like crazy) Maybe my teeth aren't white enough? Or like the great falls, is the bedrock of my life slowly erroding underneath me. (moving closer to camera, to an inch away) Erroding. Erroooding. Errodiiiing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All work has stopped. Stunned staffers stare at the monit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stands with his jaw dropped, snaps out of it. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, cut the feed! Cut to black if you have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce is now licking the camera lens.    He steps back an signs-off. Smooth as silk. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Bruce Nolan for Eyewitness news. Back to you fuckers 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan Ortega stares frozen blankly into camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce is TOSSED OUT THE FRONT DOORS, his box of possessio spilling on the ground. Bruce FLAILS at the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce carries his box to his car, when he HEARS A NOISE. A street GANG is hassling the HOMELESS SIGN GUY. Pushing around, breaking and painting over his signs. Instinctively, Bruce walks over. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, come on guys. What are you doin'? Just leave him alone. They turn, look at Bruce, laugh and head off.    Bruce he the Sign Guy up, looks after the Gang. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you'd better keep walkin'. They stop cold, turn back to Bruce and CHARGE AT HIM. Bru attempts to run, but they leap on him in a big dog pile, swinging and kicking. Bruce is left with a bloody lip, lying beside his car. We hear the sound of smashing glass and scratching metal and gang running off. Bruce slowly gets up. Reveal Bruce's car, WINDOW'S SMASHED, PAINT SCRAPED and t word "HERO" KEY SCRATCHED ON THE DOOR. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B-e-a-utiful. (looks up) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what you get for trying to help someone. Bruce gets in, pulls out of the parking lot passing the Homeless Man who sits beaten up holding a scrawled out si

dialogues.speaker: "LIFE IS. JUST"
dialogues.text: BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a clue, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce is pacing, holding an ICE PACK to his swollen lip. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God you're alright. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, yeah. Let's thank God. Thanks for everything, Lord. I am so honored that my horrible demise is a part of your loving and mysterious plan. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce, don't talk like that. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, don't worry, he's not listening. If he is he doesn't care. Have you seen the news lately? We got gangs, we got drugs, we got corruption. What kind of God lets that happen? Every time we cure a disease he comes up with a new one! (goes into God character) Yeah, is this the lab? Yeah, it's God. They've just come up with a treatment for syphilis down there. I think it's time to release the tainted monkey. Oh, and there's a guy in Ohio who's praying for strength and wisdom, blind him and cut off his legs. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So God is torturing us? BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about it, Grace. God is all- powerful . He could fix everything in five minutes if he wanted to. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he doesn't want to. He doesn't like me. Sam starts PEEING ON THE RUG. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Perfect! (to the dog) But you're aim isn't so good, I'm over herel GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce, please. This isn't his fault. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not. (hushed tone) It's part of the mysterious plan. Grace puts Sam outside. Returns, trying to calm Bruce. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you're mad right now. It's understandable. And what Evan did was slimy and wrong. But your job doesn't matter to me. You matter to me. You could've really been hurt. I'm just glad you're okay. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay? News flash: I'm not okayi And I'm not okay with the fact that you think everything is okay. I'm not okay with a mediocre job. I'm not okay with a mediocre apartment. I'm not okay with a mediocre LIFE! Bruce angrily swipes at the table knocking the photos and photo albums to floor. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you have, Bruce? A mediocre life? Well, I'm sorry for being a piece in your mediocre puzzle. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrific. I'm drowning and you throw me a brick! Grace starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect! I'll have the worst day of my life with a side order of guilt, please. I-- I don't need this. Bruce grabs his keys and heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's RAINING now. Bruce drives, going nowhere in particul His frustration is turning to desperation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, God. You want me to talk to you? Then talk back. Tell me what's going on? What should I do? Give me a sign... Bruce passes a BLINKING YELLOW CAUTION LIGHT, doesn't notice. . . BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm right here. Speak to me. A PEDESTRIAN stepping into the crosswalk, steps back out the way. PEDESTRIAN

dialogues.speaker: SLOW DOWN, ASSHOLE
dialogues.text: Bruce is oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I need is some guidance. Please send me a signal. A TRUCK TRANSPORTING VARIOUS ROAD SIGNS pulls in front of Br uce . F our way s, bli nki ng. The va rie d s igns re Wrong Way, Dead End, Do Not Enter, Stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh well, I guess you don't care. Bruce spots the PRAYER BEADS hanging on the rearview mirr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we'll do it your way. (pulls the beads from the mirror)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord, I need a miracle. Please help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits a bump and the BEADS DROP TO THE FLOOR.        Br reaches down, fishes for the beads... BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, where'd you go? (holds them up in triumph) Ah ha! AHHH! And BAM!11 BRUCE'S CAR SLAMS INTO A LIGHT POST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce stumbles out, surveys his demolished car, then look the beads in his hands. He begins to laugh maniacally. He spots the lake, starts running toward it like a madman HEAVES THE PRAYER BEADS INTO THE LAKE. He looks heavenwar challenging the Infinite. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, if that's the way you want it. The gloves are off, pal! Let me see a little wrath! Smite me oh mighty smiteri What, no pestilence no boils? Come on, you got me on the ropes, don't you want to finish me off?! You're the one who should be fired! The only one around here not doing his job is YOU! What are we, you're little pet project? A hobby you tinker with now and again? Answer me. ANSWER ME!!! A beat of silence then Bruce's BEEPER GOES OFF. He cynica chuckles at the timing, checks it, sees 772-5623. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, don't know you, wouldn't call you if I did. Bruce walks off toward his wrecked car, it BEEPS AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BEEPING continues. We are in. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce wakes, slaps at the alarm clock, groggy, reaches fo the phone, finally realizes it's the beeper. He gets up, begrudgingly, checks it. The same number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hello again 772-5623, don't hold your breath. Bruce tosses the pager on the bed, heads for the bathroom The beeper BEEPS. Bruce stops in his tracks, turns, opens the window, grabs the beeper and FIRES IT OUT. It SHATTER against a telephone pole. He calmly continues to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A note is stuck in the bathroom mirror, with an old pictu of he and Grace in happier times. The note simply says: "I LOVE YOU.    WE NEED TO TALK. Grace" Peering over top of the note, Bruce sees Sam circling on rug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce runs down the stairs carrying the trickling, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce sets Sam on the grass. Sam looks up, finished. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the point? BEEP, BEEP, BEEP... Bruce walks over to the shattered beeper. He picks up a small piece of it containing the LED read out: 772-5623

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denied that promotion at work? Is life unfair? Everywhere you turn is there someone less talented than you reaping all the benefits ? Is your name Bruce? Then do we have the job for you. We're located at 77256 23rd Street... Bruce reaches for a pen, begins jotting down the address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So come on down, or we'll just keep beepin' ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old building on the outskirts of town. A faded sign painted on the wall reads, OMNI PRESENTS. Bruce's demolished car enters frame.      He studies the building suspiciously. Bruce cautiously moves towards the structure and then, ST IN A PUDDLE. He SINKS UP TO HIS KNEE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect. He gets out, shakes off his sopping leg, and heads inside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce enters and checks the BUILDING DIRECTORY.      It r OMNI PRESENTS UNLTD. Pers onnel    Rm. 7 Ac coun ting Rm. 7 Security      Rm . 7 Creativ e     Rm. 7

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're looking for room 7. Bruce turns to see a JANITOR mopping the floor.     He lo Bruce's wet leg, offers the mop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to even those up for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feigns a smile) How would I get to room 7? JANITOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'd be on the seventh floor. Stairs are right over there. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the elevator? He points to an elevator bank a couple of steps away. JANITOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of order. Bruce heads for the stairs. JANITOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mind giving me a hand with this floor? BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Yeah, I mind. He continues on.

dialogues.speaker: SEVENTH FLOOR
dialogues.text: The stairwell door opens up to a LARGE ROOM with a SINGLE DESK at the end of an otherwise empty space. Bruce hears someone tinkering atop a tall ladder extendin into a hole in the ceiling. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Hello. I'm, ah, looking for whoever runs this joint... MAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be right with y.a, just fixin' a light. Tell me if it's working? CLICK and an INSANELY BRIGHT WHITE LIGHT ILLUMINATES, shi down blinding Bruce. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep, seems to be. (wiping his eyes) Kinda bright, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An electrician, silhouetted in the bright light, descends ladder. MAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it is for most people. They spend their lives in the dark... As he talks he steps down next to Bruce and we see that i the SAME JANITOR. JANITOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . . . thinkin' they can hide from me. The two stand, angelically illuminated.    Bruce tries to everything together. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, the elevator's broken, huh? JANITOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I'll get around to it. The Janitor CLAPS HIS HANDS TWICE and the light goes off. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You installed a clapper? JANITOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.   Catchy jingle, though. (sings)

dialogues.speaker: OFF. THE CLAPPER.
dialogues.text: (claps twice) You can't get it out of your head. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go. JANITOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, but the boss'11 be right out. The Janitor unzips his uniform, revealing a very nice sui He extends his hand to Bruce. JANITOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be Bruce. I've been expecting you. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this is hilarious. So you're the boss and the electrician and the janitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANITOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin' wrong with rollin' up your sleeves, son. People underestimate the benefits of good 'ol manual labor. There's freedom in it. Happiest people in the world stink like hell at the end of the day. He strolls down the room, takes a seat behind the big des JANITOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father knew that. He was a damn good welder. Bruce approaches the desk. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know my father? And how did you get my pager number? JANITOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I know a lot about you Bruce. Pretty much everything there is to know. Everything you've ever said, done or thought about doin', is right there in that file cabinet. He points out a single drawer file cabinet. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Wow, a whole drawer. Just for me? Mind if I take a look? JANITOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your life. Bruce pulls the drawer and it FLIES OPEN, DRAGGING HIM TH

dialogues.speaker: FULL LENGTH OF THE ROOM --
dialogues.text: The Janitor casually pulls a file. JANITOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now this last entry was a little disturbing. He thumps the file cabinet with his fist and the drawer dramatically sucks closed, DRAGGING BRUCE BACK. The Janit reads from the file. JANITOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads, scanning) Thanks for everything, Lord. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANITOR (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so honored that my horrible demise is a part of your loving and mysterious plan.. The gloves are off, pal.. Smite me oh mighty smiter. (aside) I'm not much for blaspheming but that one made me laugh. Oh, and let's not forget "What kind of a God would let this happen? I mean, have you seen then news lately?" Bruce stands, dazed. В· BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? JANITOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the creator of the heavens and the earth. I'm the alpha & omega. The first and the last. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, it's not ringing a bell. JANITOR/GOD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm God, Bruce. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you're God. Well that explains everything1 That's how you know everything about me. That's how you got up to the seventh floor so quickly. (placating) Well, it's really nice to meet you. Thanks for the Grand Canyon and, ah, good luck with the apocalypse. Bruce turns to leave, BUT FINDS HIMSELF WALKING RIGHT TOW GOD AND HIS DESK. He tries again, and again. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I don't know how you're doing that, but I really gotta go. This place is obviously rigged in some way. We're on some freaky hidden camera show. (playing to the "cameras") ...for which I will not sign a release, by the way! But you know what, I'd be a little more impressed if you didn't use the cheesy file cabinet illusion. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE      (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone with a      brain in their head would know that      the drawer is being В·             fed through the       wall from behind-- Bruce pulls the file cabinet from the wall, sees it has a normal back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.     That's good.   That's a good one. Bruce quickly puts his hands behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, God. How many fingers am I holding out? Bruce extends three fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three. He quickly pulls one finger in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two. Bruce begins switching fingers rapidly.      God doesn't beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four. Nine. Six. Eight. One... One final attempt, Bruce holds seven fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, how about now. He quickly pulls in two fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AH HAl Bruce proudly presents his single hand of five extended fingers to God, then immediately notices he has SEVEN FIN ON HIS ONE HAND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AAAHHHl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his fingers wildly and the two extra fingers disappear. God approaches Bruce. GOD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been doing a lot of complaining about me, Bruce. And quite frankly, I'm tired of it... Bruce backs away from God. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stay away from me! I don't know what your doing. But whatever you're doing is probably actionable! GOD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's not very neighborly. I brought you here to offer you a job. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Job? Wh at job? GOD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My job. You think you can do it better, so here's your chance. When you leave this building you will be endowed with all my powers. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, whatever you say, Pal. He turns to go but GOD STANDS BEFORE HIM in the Janitor uniform, holding the mop. GOD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the power of God. Bruce glances back at the empty desk, turns back again an God the Janitor has also vanished. A beat, then Bruce sprints out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce barrels out of the building -- BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, that did not happen. He races to his car stepping in the SAME PUDDLE, but this time his foot doesn't sink, he WALKS RIGHT ACROSS IT. He paus es f or a bea t --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He races on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce jumps in, turns the key, the car turns over but doe start. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm having a breakdown. That's what it is. Just a normal, everyday psychotic episode, brought on by tumor or brain lesion... We hear the car wind down to nothing. Bruce releases the pounds the steering wheel in frustration. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the car) Come on, startI The car INSTANTLY starts. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (denial) Well, that was lucky. Bruce backs up, peels out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce drives, whistling the tune, catches himself, immediately stops whistling. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, just relax here. I did not meet God and I do not have his powers. (laughs) If that was God, then I'm Mario Andretti. Instantly, Bruce's car PEELS OUT, races through traffic, dodging and passing cars right and left. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly there is a GUY IN A RED PIT CREW SUIT standing before Bruce waving a red flag. Bruce swerves to avoid th man and SCREECHES into a pit stop. Several other red-suit Italian men engulf the car. Bruce watches in amazement as professional racing team jacks up his car, slaps on HUGE TIRES, gases him up, etc. PAUL NEWMAN leans into the driver's window. PAUL NEWMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Mario, did you get that box of dressing I sent you? Bruce responds against his will IN PERFECT ITALIAN -- BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in perfect Italian) Si, dovete venire sopra per il pranzo un certo tempo. (SUBTITLES: Yes, you must come over for dinner some time.) Bruce reacts shocked.   The crew backs off and urges him Italian. PIT CREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vete l Ve tel Bruce's car peels out on it's own, he struggles to contro the wheel, finally pulling over to a curb. His car door won't open so he has to crawl out of the driver's window. He rushes onto the sidewalk, backing away from his normal looking Tauras. Not knowing what to do, he slips into a diner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce quickly walks to a back corner booth. The only othe patron is an OLD MAN seated at the counter. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't real, it isn't real, it isn't real... An older. Sally Kirkland-type WAITRESS, order pad in hand stands listening to Bruce with a raised eyebrow. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hi, ah, coffee please. The waitress pours him a cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a special on soup today. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's okay. WAITRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's tomato. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, okay. She heads off.    Bruce sits thinking.   Could it be real He looks at the SUGAR down at the end of the table, holds his hand and the SUGAR SLIDES ACROSS THE TABLE RIGHT INTO HAND. The CREAMER slides into his other hand. Bruce is half scared, half thrilled. He pours some cream sugar into his cup, looks around the table. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me I need a spoooo... Bruce chokes up a spoon into his hands, wipes it off with napkin. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's alright, I found one. The Old Man eyes Bruce suspiciously, gets up and moves further down the counter. The Waitress sets down the soup, heads off, then turns ba WAITRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lie to my sister. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? WAITRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (becoming emotional) And I'm sleeping with my best friend's husband. I know he's just using me but.. I'm just so tired of being alone. I don't know why I'm telling you all this. Just seems like you'd understand. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sets the check down) Take care of that whenever you're ready. Bruce looks at the soup. His look grows intense.   He slo raises his hands over the soup bowl....

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC UP
dialogues.text: The front door blows open, as A WIND SWIRLS through the d and with all the flourish of Moses at the Red Sea, BRUCE PARTS HIS RED SOUP. A little cockroach scurries across the table, climbs up t edge of the bowl and walks through to the other side. GOD (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Havin' fun? Bruce is startled and the soup splashes back to normal collapsing on the cockroach. He looks up at God standing beside the booth. Bruce is now awestruck. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You- He- Thy... GOD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's take a walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God leans down, lets the little soup covered cockroach go God and Bruce then walk along the lake shore. GOD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the cockroach) Most people want to kill these guys. I'm quite fond of em'. Very streamlined design. Like little armored tanks. Y'know, they can hold their breath for forty minutes and their cells divide only once per molting cycle creating a cytoskeleton with cell adhesion that... (catching himself) Oh, this is a bit over your head, isn't it? Off Bruce's look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let me explain the rules. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rules ? GOD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you left in such a rush I didn't get a chance to explain. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well the two extra fingers freaked me out a little bit. GOD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) I figured that would get your attention.. I did the same thing to Ghandi, he couldn't eat for three weeks. Now, here's the deal. You have all my power. Use it any way you choose. There are only two rules. You can't tell anyone you're God. Believe me you don't want that kind of attention. And you can't mess with free will. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.   Can I-ask why? GOD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) Yes you can. That's the beauty it. Suddenly a LARGE SAILBOAT SAIL PASSES RIGHT BY THEM.   Br looks to the sail, oddly, then... WIDE ANGLE - REVEAL God and Bruce are now walking ON THE about 100 feet from the shore. They watch the sailboat pa Bruce is awestruck. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is amazing. GOD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, speaking of amazing... God dips his hand in the Lake and pulls out THE PRAYER BE He pockets them as he talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since you're finished with these, I think I'll hang to 'em. Might come in handy someday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God and Bruce are tiny figures on the river, as God begin walk away. GOD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be seein' ya. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? GOD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking a vacation. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God can't take a vacation. Can he? Can you? GOD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever hear of the Dark Ages? Besides, I'm covered. You can fix everything in five minutes if you want to, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Right. Left alone, Bruce begins to carefully tip toe back to sho progresses to a full sprint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace and Debbie stand at the check-out stand. Grace flip through a celeb magazine, as Debbie places the last few i from the cart to the conveyor belt. In the background, throughout, Debbie's daughter, Zoe is grabbing random items off the shelves and placing them on belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: magazine) Gosh, this girl is so talented and all they ever talk about is her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she should marry somebody famous, take the focus off. Grace checks her cell phone screen. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We would have heard it ring. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. It's just that he usually calls during the day. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just needs to blow off some steam, he'll be fine. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so. I've never seen him                        * that mad. An d I lashed back--                        * DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, you lashed? You never lash. I'm impressed. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel bad for him.   He's wanted anchor for so long. Zoe begins pulling groups of items onto the belt. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I've been praying to win the lottery for fifteen years, but it's not going to happen. You know, it's not all about money. The CLERK finishes ringing the last item. CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll be four hundred and twenty- seven, eighty.-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! Debbie looks in a bag, pulls out a handful of various cou items. Zoe giggles and proudly holds up one of the hundre or so Tic-Tac mint containers. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe. (to Clerk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEBBIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, I might need you to un- check a few things. The people in line hem and haw, exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, lady. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snaps) Hey, everybody back-off i Zoe laughs, enjoying the commotion. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I better get back. I want to be there for him. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a saint, Grace. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I say, I love him. And if I know Bruce, he's out there wandering around with the weight of the world on his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce struts down the street the embodiment of confidence He turns shooting a finger at a fire hydrant, it BLASTS WATER. KIDS run off their front steps, start playing. A PRETTY GIRL IN A DRESS, comes' walking toward him. As s passes he BLOWS A LITTLE AIR OUT OF THE CORNER OF HIS MOU and turns to watch her SKIRT FLY UP. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he saw that it was good. He spots a    mannequin in a store window display, wearin cool, casu   al outfit. He closes his eyes. When he opens them, HE'S   WEARING THE COOL NEW OUTFIT and the mannequi dressed in   his clothes. He checks his reflection. . . b Bruce rounds the corner, sees the SAME GANG that beat him hanging out in the alley. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B-e-a-utifull

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce approaches the gang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey guys, remember me? The gang members turn to Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh look, it's the hero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hungry for another can of whoop- ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your stereo sounds great in my car, man. He and a couple other gang members laugh and high-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't want to fight you guys. So as soon as you apologize, I'll be on my way. A beat, then the Hoods BURST OUT LAUGHING.         A few behind, surrounding Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. I'll apologize... The day a monkey climbs out of my butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a coincidence. That's today. The Hood gets a PAINED LOOK, starts gyrating around, then MONKEY comes climbing out the back of his baggy pants. The Big Guy looks at Hood #1.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did that come out of your butt, man? Hood #1 faints from shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I'm going to have to teach the rest of you guys a lesson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOOD #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you and whose army? BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just me... and me... ANOTHER BRUCE steps out from behind a stack of crates. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And me, and me, and me, me, me, me, me and me and me. As Bruce talks, DUPLICATE BRUCE'S begin popping out from various spots, a doorway, hanging down from a fire escape dumpster pops open, six Bruce's jump out. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: T HE B RUGES CONV ERGE ON TH E GA NG --
dialogues.text: Hood #2 is instantly tackled by THREE BRUGES -- ONE BRUCE kneels down behind a hood, ANOTHER BRUCE pushes down over his back. The two Bruce's high-five -- A Hood climbs a fire escape. ONE BRUCE gives a hand up to ANOTHER BRUCE, who takes pursuit. ANOTHER BRUCE leans out a window SMASHES a potted plant over his head --

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MONKEY
dialogues.text: Our Bruce stands in the middle of the action, happily watching the mayhem. HOOD #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here, manl Hood #2 takes off running, the gang members follow. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay guys, Kum Ba Yal The Bruce's jog over, leaping and diving into Bruce's bod BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take it from here. Bruce takes a deep breath, OPENS HIS MOUTH WIDE, RELEASIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang streams out of the alley screaming, COVERED IN LOCUSTS. Bruce exits the alley, the monkey at his side.        He to the monkey. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back home for you, little one. The monkey takes off back into the alley, as we see HOOD stumbling to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NoI   NOOOOO1 He takes off running, the monkey in hot pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: ON BRUCE
dialogues.text: He belches and one last locust flies out.      He reacts unpleasant aftertaste and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We widen to an UP ANGLE of him standing on the top of Buffalo's tallest SKYSCRAPER. Clouds swirl behind him. He looks out over the vast city lights, opens his arms and proclaims to the world. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: MY WILL BE DONE I
dialogues.text: Bruce poses in dramatic god-like form, lightning crashes behind him. He is an awesome god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace sits on the floor next to the coffee table with a b of photos working on the album. She takes a sip of wine, sets down the glass. Sam walks over and laps up the wine. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sam) Well, at least I have someone to drink with. Grace hears Bruce coming up the stairs, singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if God was one of us. . . Just a slob like one of us... Just a stranger on a bus... Trying to make his way. . . Grace reacts a bit surprised by Bruce's happy tone, she g up, opens the door and there stands BRUCE, beaming smile, holding a very unique BOUQUET OF FLOWERS. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finishing song) ...home. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the flowers) Oh, my God. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can call me Bruce. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you been? You're so...happy. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wouldn't be on a night like this? (holding out the flowers) For you. Grace takes the flowers, gives Bruce a kiss, still sizing his mood. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are amazing. What are they? BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a totally new breed. A cross pollination between tulips and Daisies. I call them Todayzees. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todayzees? Okay... Grace goes to put them in water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce, is there something you're not telling me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing of this world. Why? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, why? Last night you weren't exactly happy with life. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night, I was only human. Bruce backs out of the kitchen seductively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce breezes through, casually instructs the stereo as h passes. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CD 4, Track 7. The Stereo illuminates and Barry White music plays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce opens the doors, steps onto the balcony. He surveys the cloudy sky, reaches up with his hand and ERASES THE CLOUDS, LIKE ON A CHALKBOARD. Still not completely satisfied he reaches up toward the m and makes a LASSOING MOTION, THEN BEGINS TO PULL.

dialogues.speaker: OUTER SPACE
dialogues.text: Earth far off in the distance - And with a THUNDEROUS RUM the MOON starts MOVING CLOSER TO EARTH.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Bruce adds a finishing touch by adding several stars with points of his finger. Grace joins Bruce on the balcony and is taken aback by th perfectly orchestrated sky. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, it really cleared up. I've never seen the moon that big. Bruce puts his arms around Grace from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We shouldn't waste it. Bruce starts kissing her neck. Grace turns, .they kiss an METEOR SHOWER lights the sky behind them. The kiss ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bedroom. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace grabs a neglige from the drawer, heads into the bathroom. Bruce enters, adjusts the ambience of the room, BLOWS THE LIGHTS OUT with a quick puff of air, LIGHTS CAN with a gesture. His clothes magically fall away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace slips her neglige on, begins brushing her hair. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'11 be out in a minute. BRUCE (O.S.)                                *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't rush yourself. Sometimes                        * anticipation can heighten the                         * pleasure.                                             * Grace SHUDDERS a bit at the word "pleasure", quickly fini brushing, picks up her lipstick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a funny thing about, pleasure.                   * GRACE'S KNEES BUCKLE, causing the lipstick to smear acros her face. She sits down on the toilet seat to get a hold herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can be extremely pleasurable.                      * Grace has a very POWERFUL ORGASM and slides off the toile out of frame to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out of control)                                  * Oh, oh. Oh my...                                      *

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Standing at the door with both arms extended toward the bathroom like an WARLOCK CASTING A SPELL. Suddenly the li hits him from the open bathroom door and he quickly strik casual pose. Grace stands in the open doorway, panting like an animal. She dives on Bruce, attacking him.

dialogues.speaker: ON TV
dialogues.text: MORNING REPORTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In international news, Japanese relief workers are staging a desperate effort to rescue hundreds of people stranded by a freak tidal wave that hit Kitamoto City... We see remote footage of Japanese families being airlifte from root tops. MORNING REPORTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scientists say the tsunami may have been caused by what they're describing as "unusual lunar activity." More on this, as it develops. . . Grace half watches the newscast as she finishes breakfast

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce lies blissfully asleep. Big smile, life is good. Then, we hear WHISPERING - Like distant voices MURMURING at once. Bruce wakes with a start. He looks around puzzle sticks his finger in his ear checking his hearing as the voices fade away.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Circling, getting ready to go on the carpet. Bruce casual warns. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam. Uh uh uh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks at Bruce for a beat, then  walks into bathroom, raises the toilet seat with his nos e, and STANDS UP ON H

dialogues.speaker: TWO HIND LEGS, HOLDING HIS SNAUSAGE WITH HIS FRONT PAWS
dialogues.text: WE DON'T SEE IT) AND STARTS TO GO.   He looks proudly bac Bruce. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace places breakfast on the table. Bruce comes out, ful dressed with a spring in his step. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gushy-lovey, sing songy) Good morning. Cooked you grilled cheese. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oo, my favey. Bruce sits, Grace sets down his plate, leans close. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night was just... BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heavenly? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm hmm. Bruce enjoys his grilled cheese. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's funny, but when I woke up this morning, It felt like my boobs were bigger. Bruce looks away, guilty, trying to be nonchalant. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding them up) Do they look bigger to you? BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? Ah, no, they, ah, look the same to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They aren't.    They are clearly bigger.      She holds t GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're definitely bigger.      They feel huge to me. Bruce throws up his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got me. Probably just a hormonal thing. (takes a quick final bite) Well, enjoy your breakfast, I've gotta run. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? He stops, turns. A new confident Bruce. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get my job back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce heads for his severely beat-up junker car whistling "What if God were One of Us."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets in, fastens his seat belt, as two teenagers cruis on skateboards, stop outside Bruce's window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sincerely impressed) Wow, nice car man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it gets me from A to B.

dialogues.speaker: MASTER
dialogues.text: Reveal Bruce's car is now a brand new MERCEDES 2003 VISIO SLR. He starts and revs THE POWERFUL NEW ENGINE and peels out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce turns the corner into bumper to bumper traffic. No problem, the traffic magically opens up for him, cars instantly swerving right and left clearing a path for Bru He waves as he passes. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the last shall be first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POLICE DOG, HANK, performs some standard TAKE DOWNS by "attacking" a "criminal" (trainer) on the run. PHIL, a reporter from a rival station is wrapping up his story. PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I certainly wouldn't want to be a fugitive on the run with Hank, Buffalo's number one police dog, on the job. This is Phil Sidleman reporting from The Police Canine Training center. (beat) And cut it. Let's go, guys. The crew start to wrap up.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Watching the action from the side, holding his own home v camera. Phil spots him. PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, channel seven, right? You're the guy that went crazy. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I had a bad day. But things are lookin' up. PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doin' here? BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just lookin' for a story. PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving the video tape) Well, this pond's fished out. Pretty standard stuff anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. My instinct tells me there's something more. PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, go with that. It's served you well in the past, right? Phil and a couple of his crew laugh, as they load the las their equipment into the van and shut the doors. TRAINER (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Hank found something1 Phil turns back, Bruce and he exchange a glance. Hank is DIGGING FURIOUSLY, making a BIG HOLE. The Policem jogs over, joins the trainer. They watch as TWO DRESS SHO ARE UNCOVERE D IN THE DI RT. Hank BARKS. POLICEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a bodyI PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his crew) Shit. Get the camera, now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It LOCKS AUTOMATICALLY.   The CAMERAMAN yanks at the door CAMERAMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's locked and the keys are inside I Bruce casually turns his camera on, gives Phil a "tough break" look, heads for the scene, as Phil and his crew scramble around the van.

dialogues.speaker: ON A TV
dialogues.text: DAN RATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The body of Jimmy Hoffa was uncovered in a field today outside of a canine training center in Buffalo New York. Local Buffalo freelance field reporter Bruce Nolan was the first on the scene...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cut to the pre-taped story. Bruce stands with Hank and his trainer before camera, the body being exhumed from th ground behind him. BRUCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since the disapearence of Teamster president Jimmy Hoffa in the nineteen sixties, his whereabouts have remained one of this country's great unsolved mysteries. That is until just moments ago, when during a routine training session, a police dog named Hank sniffed his way right into the history books. As you can see behind us, the body is being carefully exhumed and will be transported to a hospital facility where DNA testing will confirm the identity. That, of course, only a formality as in a bizarre twist, the body was found buried with a birth certificate and complete set of dental records.
